name: Indonesian Pork Satay
author: Debbie
summary: Serve with dipping sauce on the side. Chicken, beef, or lamb can also be used instead of pork.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1 inch cubes
directions: In a food processor, process garlic, green onions, ginger, peanuts, lemon juice, honey, soy sauce, coriander, and red pepper flakes
Pour in broth and butter, and mix again
Place pork cubes in a large resealable plastic bag, and pour mixture over meat
Marinate in the refrigerator for 6 hours, or overnight
Remove pork cubes from bag, and thread onto skewers
In a small saucepan, boil the marinade for 5 minutes
Reserve a small amount of the marinade for basting, and set the remainder aside to serve as a dipping sauce
Grill for 10 to 15 minutes, or until well browned, turning and brushing frequently with cooked marinade
